justification: "For instance, the commonly used Diffusion Decision Model (DDM) posits that individuals probabilistically sample information over time, incrementally accumulate evidence based on this information, and reach a decision upon reaching a critical evidence threshold."
"The first model we examine, the Simple DDM (sDDM), is the simplest EAM we examine and the basis of all upcoming models. We use this model as the baseline by which to gauge recovery."

"The leaky integration model, referred to as 'Leakage' from here on, is an extension of the sDDM with leaky integration added to the drift rate… Leakage is used to more realistically describe the accumulation process by modeling the decay of excitatory currents in decision neurons (Usher & McClelland, 2001)."

"The principal threshold we study here is the Weibull threshold. This threshold uses a Weibull cumulative distribution function to model the decision threshold behavior. It is a commonly used threshold due to its flexibility in behavior."
"The Reduced Weibull threshold is identical to the Weibull threshold … with the exception that the collapse parameter is fixed at c = −1, … reducing the number of parameters it adds to the sDDM."
"The next two simpler CTs we examine are the linear and exponential thresholds… The first, linear, defines the decision thresholds as, b1(t)= −b2(t) = b0 − mt…"
"The second, exponential, defines the decision thresholds as, b1(t)= −b2(t) = b0 exp(−t/τ ), where … τ describes the rate of threshold collapse."
"The Urgency Gating Model (UGM)… proposes an alternate… account for decision making behavior… u(t) is a gain function which describes an increasing urgency to make a response."

"The Diffusion Model of Conflict (DMC) is an EAM used to describe conflict tasks… Conflict tasks are decision scenarios where conflicting evidence is present for the correct response. The DMC was developed to model all three."
